Clever.notes: 2FA is only available for district admins

Udemy.notes: 2FA is only available for instructor accounts

Acquia.notes: SMS 2FA is only available for US or Canada phone numbers.

Hostinger.notes: You can only have one 2FA option enabled at a time.

TransIP.notes: While both the main control panel and STACK support 2FA, each system is separate and requires its own setup.

UpCloud.notes: SMS is required for password recovery.

Domeneshop.notes: SMS available only to customers in Norway, Sweden and Denmark.

Dyn.notes: Currently only supported for the Managed DNS & Email Delivery platforms (via DynID). Eventually DynID (and 2FA) will be rolled out to all platforms (no ETA).

GoDaddy.notes: If hardware 2FA enabled, customer support by phone requires enabling back-up method.

Rebel.com.notes: You must contact customer support to enable 2FA.

united-domains.de.notes: A phone number is required to enable two-factor authentication.

Whois.notes: TOTP 2FA is only available for resellers.

Bitbucket.notes: An SSH key must be associated with your account to enable 2FA.

Buddy.notes: 2FA is only available to users on paid plans.

Bugzilla@Mozilla.notes: Proprietary 2FA methods are only available for Mozilla employees.

CloudAMQP.notes: SMS is required as a backup method

Formsite.notes: 2FA is only available for Pro 3 accounts or higher.

GitHub.notes: Hardware tokens must have a backup method, either SMS or software token.

Hotjar.notes: 2FA is not available for SAML SSO logins

MxToolbox.notes: 2FA is only available on paid plans.

npm.notes: The security-key flow using WebAuthn is currently in beta.

Pivotal Tracker.notes: 2FA only works on the web version. If enabled, you will not be able to use the mobile apps.

Redis Enterprise Cloud.notes: SMS 2FA must be enabled before TOTP 2FA can be enabled. SMS 2FA cannot be disabled even when TOTP is enabled.

Chatwork.notes: SMS 2FA is only available to users on paid plans

Firmex VDR.notes: 2FA must be enabled by a site administrator before use.

Kintone.notes: 2FA must be enabled by an admin before use.

Notejoy.notes: 2FA is not available to Free plan users and is not available on the Android app.

Segment.notes: SMS 2FA is only available for US and Canada phone numbers.

SendSafely.notes: TOTP 2FA requires SMS as a backup option

Skype.notes: Must be associated with a Microsoft Account.

SmartSurvey.notes: SMS 2FA is only available for Enterprise users.

Commercial Bank of Qatar.notes: An SMS capable phone with a Qatar phone number is required.

Macquarie Bank.notes: 2FA is only available when 'Ultimate' security is enabled and an SMS-capable phone is required for initial setup.

Metro Bank Commercial.notes: Only available for Business Online Plus and Commercial Banking customers. Setup for authenticator app requires SMS verification. Only UK phone numbers can be used.

RBC Caribbean.notes: Hardware 2FA methods are only available for business customers.

RBC Royal Bank.notes: 2FA can only be enabled via the app

Volksbanken Raiffeisenbanken.notes: Support for 2FA types depends on regional V&R banks.

1Password.notes: TOTP 2FA must be enabled before U2F 2FA can be enabled. Teams using Duo with 1Password can't enable other 2FA methods. Non-U2F Hardware tokens and custom software methods are only available through Duo.

Bitwarden.notes: 2FA options other than email and TOTP are only available on paid plans

LastPass.notes: Availability of 2FA options depends on your account type. U2F is available through Duo integration on all plans. Yubico OTP is only available on paid plans.

SecureSafe.notes: 2FA is only available on paid plans.

Cliniko.notes: Setting up 2FA requires adding a phone number.

Virgin Pulse.notes: SMS 2FA is only available for US and Canada phone numbers.

Ancestry.notes: SMS 2FA is currently only available for customers with a U.S. based phone number.

Domain.notes: 2FA is not available on the app.

Egnyte.notes: Availability of 2FA options depends on your account type.

ImmobilienScout24.notes: SMS is only available to commercial real estate providers.

Immowelt.notes: 2FA is only available for commercial partners.

Repairshopr.notes: SMS only available as a backup to Google Authenticator.

Scalefusion.notes: Only account owners and co-account owners can enable 2FA.

Shopify.notes: U2F requires using a Shopify ID. U2F can't be used on the Shopify mobile app, the Shopify POS app, or the Shopify Inbox app.

SimplyBook.notes: 2FA is only available as a 'custom feature' and must be enabled by an admin before use.

TurboSquid.notes: 2FA is only available with a verified email address

WageWorks.notes: Employer/plan sponsor may opt to not offer 2FA.

Wikipedia.notes: Currently limited to administrators (and users with admin-like permissions like interface editors), bureaucrats, checkusers, oversighters, stewards, edit filter managers and the OATH-testers global group.

Bitbns.notes: SMS 2FA must be enabled before TOTP 2FA.

Bitbuy.notes: SMS 2FA is only available for country code +1 (North America)

BitMEX.notes: At most one 2FA method can be enabled at any time.

BTC Markets.notes: A mobile phone number is required to reset two-factor authentication.

Coinify.notes: 2FA is only available for merchant accounts. myCoinify trading accounts do not support 2FA.

CoinPayU.notes: You need to verify email address before enable 2FA.

Digital Surge.notes: A mobile phone number is required to set up two-factor authentication.

Kraken.notes: Email 2FA is mandatory for all users but only requested for unknown devices

Luno.notes: A mobile phone number is required to set up two-factor authentication.

NAGA.notes: MFA can only be set up from the NAGA Web platform and not on iOS or Android Apps

ArtStation.notes: 2FA must be enabled from the app and requires email confirmation to setup.

Facebook.notes: Hardware 2FA requires also enabling a back-up method

Twitter.notes: SMS only available on select providers.

Arlo.notes: Email 2FA is always available as a backup.

Nest.notes: Non-migrated accounts only have SMS & Email 2FA available.

Wyze.notes: 2FA via SMS is only available for USA and Canada.

Fidelity Investments.notes: Specific support varies between account types

Interactive Brokers.notes: SMS 2FA only works as long as no other method has been enabled. Hardware 2FA is only available for certain customers.

Vanguard.notes: Hardware based 2FA requires SMS / Phone call 2FA as a backup.

Airship.notes: 2FA is only available upon request for customers on their Essential and Comprehensive plans.

Alchemer.notes: SMS 2FA is only available for Enterprise accounts with an SMS 2FA provision.

CoinPayU.notes: You need to verify email address before enable 2FA.

Frontify.notes: 2FA is only available for Enterprise users with a security package.

Heap.notes: 2FA is only available for users on the Business plan.

HootSuite.notes: Email is always enabled as backup method for Software Token.

Hotjar.notes: 2FA is not available for SAML SSO logins

Refersion.notes: SMS 2FA is not available in all regions.

Sailthru.notes: You must contact Sailthru support to enable 2FA.

HelloSign.notes: SMS Two-factor authentication is only available to paid Business plan senders and above.

Airtable.notes: SMS must be enabled first and software 2FA can be bypassed by SMS.

ClickUp.notes: SMS only available on Business and Enterprise price plans.

Microsoft To-Do.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Monday.com.notes: Team admins must enable 2FA before members can use it.

Wrike.notes: Only accessible to Enterprise accounts and users may need to contact their account administrator to enable 2FA.

Bethesda.notes: SMS requires TOTP to be set up

Enjin.notes: 2FA is only available on paid plans.

Garena Online.notes: A mobile phone is required for 2FA.

Minecraft.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Nintendo Account.notes: 2FA not available for child accounts (users 12 years of age or younger) or supervised accounts (users 13 years of age or older attached to a parent account).

Square Enix.notes: The proprietary software implementation requires you to have purchased either Final Fantasy XI or Final Fantasy XIV and registered the game. Only one method is allowed at a time.

custom-software: The Old Republic Security Key App

Steam.notes: A phone number is required as a fallback for Steam Mobile 2FA.

Ubisoft/Uplay.notes: SMS and TOTP 2FA require adding a phone number as a fallback. SMS 2FA is not available in all regions.

Xbox Live.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Allegro.notes: SMS 2FA cannot be disabled even when TOTP is enabled.

Amazon.notes: SMS or phone call required to enable 2FA. Enabling on Amazon.com activates 2FA on other regional Amazon sites, such as UK and DE.

Depop.notes: 2FA can only be enabled via the app. Recovery codes can only be used via the app.

GoPro.notes: 2FA only applies on the GoPro website, not the app.

HackerOne.notes: SMS-capable phone required for initial setup.

Kaspersky.notes: SMS 2FA must be enabled before TOTP 2FA can be set up. SMS 2FA cannot be disabled even when TOTP is enabled.

Perimeter 81.notes: Hardware 2FA is only available via Duo.

Sophos Home.notes: Email and SMS 2FA can only be enabled as backup methods.

BGL Corporate Solutions.notes: 2FA covers Simple Fund 360, CAS 360, BGL API and BGL Account. It doesn't cover BGL Client Centre.

Bill.notes: 2FA via phone call is available for US and CA only.

Bokio Sverige.notes: BankID only available for users using banking features

Intuit TurboTax.notes: Software 2FA requires enabling SMS or phone call as a back-up.

Mint.notes: Software 2FA requires enabling SMS or phone call as a back-up.

MYOB.notes: SMS available to selected new customers only.

Quickbooks Online.notes: TOTP 2FA only available after enabling SMS or phone 2FA.

Wise.notes: SMS 2FA must be enabled before software methods can be enabled.

Canva.notes: 2FA only available to users from Australia, Philippines, UK, and USA.

Frame.notes: 2FA is only available for Enterprise users with mandated 2FA.

Amazon Pay.notes: SMS or phone call required to enable 2FA. Enabling on Amazon.com activates 2FA on other regional Amazon sites, such as UK and DE.

BlueSnap.notes: 2FA must be enabled by an admin before use.

PAYEER.notes: Receiving codes via SMS cost 0.05$ each message. 2FA is personalizable in account settings.

PayPal.notes: Some methods of 2FA are only available in a few countries. Contact PayPal for more information.

Plaid.notes: Software token is only available for developer accounts. It is not available for the my.plaid.com user portal.

Skrill.notes: Email method requires an additional PIN

Square.notes: SMS only supported in US and Canada

Western Union.notes: 2FA is only available for business accounts.

Uber.notes: 2FA can only be enabled via the app

US Veteran Affairs.notes: 2FA is only available when using the Identity Management service ID.me

BT.notes: 2FA can only be enabled via the website.

Con Edison.notes: Requires phone number to set up. Can be bypassed by customer support.

T-Mobile.notes: Backup methods of SMS or recovery questions can't be disabled.

VoIP.ms.notes: Only one of the 2FA methods can be enabled at the same time.

Xfinity.notes: Email 2FA requires the use of a non-Comcast.net email address.

Airbnb.notes: Airbnb decides when 2FA is required; user cannot enable 2FA for every login.

Booking.com.notes: Setup requires SMS verification. Email is available via 'other options' at login.

Atera.notes: 2FA must be enabled by an admin before use.

join.me (w/ LogMeIn account).notes: SMS or email must be set up as a backup method

LogMeIn.notes: SMS or email must be set up as a backup method

Remote Desktop Manager.notes: 2FA is only available on the Enterprise Edition

Aruba Cloud.notes: Only the control panel supports 2FA (the main client area does not).

Hostiso.notes: While both the main client area and the shared hosting panel support 2FA, each system is separate and requires its own setup.

Nutstore.notes: SMS 2FA only available on certain pricing plans

Redis Enterprise Cloud.notes: SMS 2FA must be enabled before TOTP 2FA can be enabled. SMS 2FA cannot be disabled even when TOTP is enabled.

Mail.com.notes: A verified phone number is required to set up 2FA.

Outlook.com.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Tutanota.notes: Hardware 2FA not yet supported for their desktop & mobile apps.

Yandex.Mail.notes: SMS-capable phone required for initial setup.

Zimbra.notes: Available in Zimbra Collaboration 8.7 and above, Network Edition only

California Institute of Technology (CalT.notes: SMS-capable phone required for initial setup.

Technische Universität Berlin.notes: 2FA is only available for selected services

University of Otago.notes: U2F is available to staff only

York University.notes: 2FA via SMS or phone call can only be enabled by the support team.

CrashPlan.notes: 2FA is not available on the CrashPlan/Code42 desktop application.

Dropbox.notes: Hardware 2FA requires also enabling Software or SMS 2FA as a back-up.

Evernote.notes: SMS and phone call are always enabled as backup methods for TOTP.

Nutstore.notes: SMS 2FA only available on certain pricing plans

OneDrive.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Onehub.notes: Software 2FA requires adding a phone number as a fallback.

Tresorit.notes: Requires enabling at least two 2FA methods.

Yandex.Disk.notes: SMS-capable phone required for initial setup.

Twitch.notes: To activate two factor authentication, you must provide a mobile phone number.

GoFundMe.notes: 2FA only for North American customers that create Personal campaigns.

Kickstarter.notes: Software 2FA requires setting up SMS 2FA as a fallback.

Uber Eats.notes: 2FA must be enabled via the Uber app, not the Uber Eats app.
